Past Marketing/Growth Attempts.Description: Ran a Facebook and Instagram ad campaign targeting local food enthusiasts.
Past Marketing/Growth Attempts.Results: Increased followers by 20%, but minimal impact on in-store visits.

Past Marketing/Growth Attempts.Description: Introduced a loyalty program offering a free meal after 10 purchases.
Past Marketing/Growth Attempts.Results: Improved customer retention by 15%, but program management costs were high.

Past Marketing/Growth Attempts.Description: Sent monthly newsletters with special offers and event announcements.
Past Marketing/Growth Attempts.Results: High open rate (40%) but low conversion to in-store visits (5%).

Growing Retention.Name: Loyalty Program Expansion
Growing Retention.Description: Implement an expanded loyalty program targeting existing customers who have not yet enrolled. Offer exclusive benefits, such as early access to new menu items or special events, to incentivize enrollment. Promote the expanded program through in-store signage, email campaigns, and social media posts.
Growing Retention.Hypothesis: By expanding the loyalty program to reach more existing customers, we expect to see an increase in repeat visits and higher retention rates as customers are motivated to return to take advantage of exclusive benefits.
Metrics: Increase in repeat visits from enrolled customers

Growing Retention.Name: Personalized Email Campaign
Growing Retention.Description: Utilize customer data to create personalized email campaigns offering tailored incentives based on past dining behavior. For example, offer a discount on a customer's favorite menu item or a free dessert on their next visit. Send these personalized emails at strategic times, such as before the customer's typical visit frequency.
Growing Retention.Hypothesis: By sending personalized offers based on past dining behavior, we expect to see an increase in customer engagement and repeat visits as customers feel valued and motivated to return to redeem their personalized incentives.
Metrics: Increase in repeat visits from customers who received personalized emails

Growing Retention.Name: Service Quality Training
Growing Retention.Description: Implement a comprehensive training program for all staff members focused on delivering high-quality service. This includes role-playing scenarios, customer interaction workshops, and ongoing feedback sessions. Monitor and track service quality through customer feedback forms and mystery shopper evaluations.
Growing Retention.Hypothesis: By consistently providing excellent service through comprehensive training, we expect to see an improvement in customer satisfaction and an increase in repeat visits as customers have a positive dining experience and are more likely to return.
Metrics: Repeat visit rate after service quality training implementation
Positive mentions of service quality on social media

Growing Retention.Name: Social Media Engagement Campaign
Growing Retention.Description: Launch a social media campaign to encourage customer engagement and interaction. This could include user-generated content contests, polls about menu preferences, or behind-the-scenes glimpses of the restaurant. Respond promptly to customer comments and messages to foster a sense of community and connection.
Growing Retention.Hypothesis: By increasing engagement on social media platforms, we expect to see a boost in customer loyalty and repeat visits as customers feel more connected to the restaurant and are reminded to visit through interactive content.
Metrics: Engagement rate on social media posts
Direct messages converted into reservations or visits

Growing Retention.Name: Feedback-Based Menu Enhancement
Growing Retention.Description: Collect feedback from customers through surveys or comment cards to identify popular and less popular menu items. Use this feedback to enhance the menu by introducing new dishes, improving existing ones, or offering customizable options based on customer preferences.
Growing Retention.Hypothesis: By incorporating customer feedback into menu enhancements, we expect to see an increase in customer satisfaction and repeat visits as customers feel their preferences are valued and are more likely to return to try new or improved menu items.
Metrics: Customer satisfaction scores related to menu items
Sales performance of new or improved menu items
Repeat visit rate after menu enhancements
